title: [7. Reverse Integer](https://leetcode.cn/problems/reverse-integer/)
content:
| English | 简体中文 |
7. Reverse Integer Description Given a signed 32-bit integer x, return x with its digits reversed. If reversing x causes the value to go outside the signed 32-bit integer range [-231, 231 - 1], then return 0.
Assume the environment does not allow you to store 64-bit integers (signed or unsigned).
 
Example 1:
Input: x = 123 Output: 321 Example 2:
Input: x = -123 Output: -321 Example 3:
Input: x = 120 Output: 21  
Constraints:
-231 <= x <= 231 - 1 Related Topics Math Similar Questions String to Integer (atoi) Reverse Bits A Number After a Double Reversal Count Number of Distinct Integers After Reverse Operations
